verses.verse: And he said<WH559> unto me, Son<WH1121> of man<WH120>, stand<WH5975> upon thy feet<WH7272>, and I will speak<WH1696> unto thee.
And the spirit<WH7307> entered<WH935> into me when he spake<WH1696> unto me, and set<WH5975> me upon my feet<WH7272>, that I heard<WH8085> him that spake<WH1696> unto me.

And he said<WH559> unto me, Son<WH1121> of man<WH120>, I send<WH7971> thee to the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, to a rebellious<WH4775> nation<WH1471> that hath rebelled<WH4775> against me: they and their fathers<WH1> have transgressed<WH6586> against me, even unto this very<WH6106> day<WH3117>. nation: Heb. nations

For they are impudent<WH7186> <WH6440> children<WH1121> and stiffhearted<WH2389> <WH3820>. I do send<WH7971> thee unto them; and thou shalt say<WH559> unto them, Thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>. impudent: Heb. hard of face

And they, whether they will hear<WH8085>, or whether they will forbear<WH2308>, (for they are a rebellious<WH4805> house<WH1004>,) yet shall know<WH3045> that there hath been a prophet<WH5030> among<WH8432> them.

And thou, son<WH1121> of man<WH120>, be not afraid<WH3372> of them, neither be afraid<WH3372> of their words<WH1697>, though briers<WH5621> and thorns<WH5544> be with thee, and thou dost dwell<WH3427> among scorpions<WH6137>: be not afraid<WH3372> of their words<WH1697>, nor be dismayed<WH2865> at their looks<WH6440>, though they be a rebellious<WH4805> house<WH1004>. briers: or, rebels
And thou shalt speak<WH1696> my words<WH1697> unto them, whether they will hear<WH8085>, or whether they will forbear<WH2308>: for they are most rebellious<WH4805>. most: Heb. rebellion

But thou, son<WH1121> of man<WH120>, hear<WH8085> what I say<WH1696> unto thee; Be not<WH1961> thou rebellious<WH4805> like that rebellious<WH4805> house<WH1004>: open<WH6475> thy mouth<WH6310>, and eat<WH398> that I give<WH5414> thee.
And when I looked<WH7200>, behold, an hand<WH3027> was sent<WH7971> unto me; and, lo, a roll<WH4039> of a book<WH5612> was therein;

And he spread<WH6566> it before<WH6440> me; and it was written<WH3789> within<WH6440> and without<WH268>: and there was written<WH3789> therein lamentations<WH7015>, and mourning<WH1899>, and woe<WH1958>.
